channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Uneven paving slabs gaps in between weeds growing, 22nd August
item.description:
MASSIVE TRIP HAZARD Neighbours have trip Prams get stuck Large gaps hazard for children Green not maintained so nature taking over All over pavements in area have been repaired but not this corner linking Macon way to roseberry

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Companies leave and burn things, 22nd August
item.description:
All around here is plenty of rubbish. sofa, chair, vegetable oil cans, etc. Every now and then people from the companies just randomly burn some of their stuff and the smell of the smoke comes into our flats on the other side of the grass wall
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ruston Road, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent - clear hedges Auburn House for disabled tenants, 22nd August
item.description:
Please could you clear/cut the hedges on Auburn/Bedford house? There is a disabled tenant on 44 Waverley Road that uses a scooter and is finding using the pavement problematic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bramblebury Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike in Disrepair abandoned for over 1 year, 22nd August
item.description:
HI, its really is an eyesore by a bucy cafe, reported before but no action from the council. It's been a year now, there is no space to park bicycles, definitely abandoned and in utter disrepair. Please remove asap.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Downham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins for Damsel Collective always overflowing, 22nd August
item.description:
Please empty these bins more regularly. They are a real eye sore and right bedside the entrance to our building.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Overgrown shrubbery blocking light, 22nd August
item.description:
Overgrown shrubbery blocking street light ao it's pitch black, plus overgrown at bottom of the bridge, shedding all over it making it dangerous to walk on

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pembroke Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous overgrown and overhanging trees, 22nd August
item.description:
All the trees at the end of Berwick Crescent from 1-15 in the centre of the road are excessively overgrown and overhanging into the road and effecting visibility. They urgently needed to be inspected and cut back. A number of them also have excessive growth at the bottom of the tree too. All the branches and leaves are hanging into the road and over cars. It’s been like this for a long time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Berwick Crescent, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extreme wet dog fouling on the pavement which is in front of 87-89 Fernhead Road., 22nd August
item.description:
Extreme wet dog fouling on the pavement which is in front of 87 - 89 Fernhead Road. This fouling is about a foot away from the kerb. There is also small droplets of dog fouling near the tree that is in front of 95 Fernhead Road. People get in and out their cars besides this tree and people cross the road besides this tree and children often play around this tree. Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cluster of potholes at many places in the street, 22nd August
item.description:
The potholes have been there for at least two years now. I am not sure if they cause an accident but definitely cars need to be slowed down driving through it. Given there is school in the street, appreciate if you can fix them

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harlington Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This vehicle now appears to have cloned number plates., 22nd August
item.description:
The original reg plates EN60EPO have been removed and reg plates WM57DDF fitted, they are NOT legitimate plates as they do not show any Motor Dealer identification. The smashed windscreen has been covered so it is not easy/possible to view the chassis number details. The Police have been informed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Venners Close, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, 22nd August
item.description:
Litter along and around the pavement on the long hedge that runs alongside The Crescent BR3 1DU along the length of the hedge, in the hedge and close to the hedge and in the road/gutter. You could say the area starts at What3words tent.tidy.movie. The hedge, pavement, gutter of The Crescent. This hedge borders the car park of Marks and Spencer. There are plastic bottles, glass bottles, cans, broom and separate handle, plastic wraps, paper wrappers, etc. Additionally, the bin on the corner of The Crescent/church avenue is full. Hopefully you will now be able to locate the problem area. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Crescent, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Goose by lake, 22nd August
item.description:
This is a dead goose lying just next to the lake. It isn't clear how it died but it looks like it could have been harmed based on it's neck position. I have checked for signs of life but it doesn't look like there are any.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Park, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet
